definition: to injure oneself in a fall
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to injure/injury/wound

sentences.english: I wonder that he didn't hurt himself jumping over that wall.
sentences.chinese: 我纳闷他怎么从那墙上跳过去竟没摔伤自己。

sentences.english: We were just going to leave when Tom fell and hurt his knee.
sentences.chinese: 我们正要走，当汤姆摔伤他的膝盖时。

sentences.english: She fell down the stairs and hurt her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她从楼上跌了下来，摔伤了腿。

sentences.english: He lost his balance and hurt himself when he went upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 他上楼时失去了平衡，摔伤了。

sentences.english: In walking on the way, jiang and much debt down from the hill, his leg hurt.
sentences.chinese: 在走的途中，江多福还掉下了山坡，把腿摔伤了。

sentences.english: Yesterday Lin Tao fell off his bike and hurt his leg .
sentences.chinese: 昨天林涛从自行车上掉下来，摔伤了腿。

sentences.english: Palmer accidentally hurt, beautiful met, raga to go out to buy medicine for him.
sentences.chinese: 帕良不小心摔伤，佳拉格为他外出买药遇到阿特。

sentences.english: The thing falls to began to have change from Song Xiaoying.
sentences.chinese: 事情从宋晓英摔伤开始有了变化。

sentences.english: Old people casts rim of the eye, is there still extravasated blood now a little swollen still how to do?
sentences.chinese: 老年人摔伤眼眶，现在还有淤血还有些肿怎么办？

sentences.english: The boy shouted for help. The boy broke his leg.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩大声呼救，他摔伤了腿。

sentences.english: He fell off the bicycle and hurt his leg.
sentences.chinese: 他从自行车上摔下来，摔伤了一条腿。

sentences.english: He had his leg broken when he tried to climb that tall tree.
sentences.chinese: 当他试着爬那高树时，他摔伤了他的腿。

sentences.english: Jack fell off his bicycle and got hurt.
sentences.chinese: 杰克骑车摔伤，得住院治疗。

sentences.english: He's got a wound in his leg and he may get a fever but it's nothing serious.
sentences.chinese: 他摔伤了腿，可能还会发烧，但没那么严重。

sentences.english: John fell down from the tree and injured his back.
sentences.chinese: 约翰从树上摔下来把背部摔伤了。

definition: to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to slip (lose one's footing)
to fall and break/to break (bones) by falling
to suffer a fracture/(of a bone) to break/fracture
bruise/bump
to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to fall down/to take a fall
to fall and fracture (a leg, vertebra etc)
high, lofty/precipitous
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
to fall and smash into pieces
to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
incautious/inattentive
to gash/to cut/gash/cut
accident
to send or deliver to the hospital
